body_content.explanation: an occasion when an aircraft rolls through 360 degrees whilst continuing to fly in a straight line:
examples: His flying instructor tested him on slow rolls and loops.
The pilot said she did a slow roll on the way down just for the view.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when you are holding good cards in the game of poker and take a longer time than is necessary to tell the other players your bet (= say how much money you are risking) or to show your winning cards:
examples: Some poker players use the slow roll to humiliate their opponents.

body_content.explanation: to intentionally do something more slowly than is necessary, or to intentionally make someone wait longer for something than is necessary:
examples: They claimed that the report on the spillage of toxic chemicals had been slow rolled.
The department's bureaucracy has effectively slow-rolled the president on his campaign promise.
He said that they were slowrolling and delaying progress in the matter.

body_content.explanation: when you are holding good cards in the game of poker, to take a longer time than is necessary to tell the other players your bet (= to say how much money you are risking) or to show your winning cards:
examples: To slowroll someone is considered incredibly bad poker etiquette.
There are some situations where someone is not slow-rolling but others may think they are.
